results.title: Simvastatin-romidepsin combination kills bladder cancer cells synergistically

results.title: Statins, commonly coprescribed drugs, and concomitant risk factors: A protective, neutral, or harmful association with common cancer types development: A 10-year multicentric retrospective lebanese study
results.text_hl: However, a duration-response relationship was established between @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ and @DISEASE_Lung_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D008175 @@@lung cancer@@@ (odds ratio [OR]=1.208) as well as @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001749 @@@bladder cancer@@@ (OR=1.189).

citations.NLM: Chalhoub IG, Boulos RT, Dagher YG, El Helou S, Haifa KG, Atallah B, Nasr F, Kassab I, Chahine MN. Statins, commonly coprescribed drugs, and concomitant risk factors: A protective, neutral, or harmful association with common cancer types development: A 10-year multicentric retrospective lebanese study Medicine (Baltimore). 2023 Sep 29;102(39):e34562. PMID: 37773843

results.title: Mevalonate Metabolic Reprogramming Drives Cisplatin Resistance in Bladder Cancer: Mechanisms and Therapeutic Targeting.
results.text_hl: In vitro, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ inhibited the proliferation of @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001749 @@@bladder cancer@@@ cells and enhanced their sensitivity to @CHEMICAL_Cisplatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002945 @@@cisplatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Fang Q, You C, Xiao X, Liu Y, Yang W, Li Q, Qing L, Dong Z. Mevalonate Metabolic Reprogramming Drives Cisplatin Resistance in Bladder Cancer: Mechanisms and Therapeutic Targeting. Protein Pept Lett. 2025 Sep 3;():. PMID: 40916434

results.title: Simvastatin induces cell cycle arrest and inhibits proliferation of bladder cancer cells via PPARgamma signalling pathway
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ induces cell cycle arrest and inhibits proliferation of @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001749 @@@bladder cancer@@@ cells via @GENE_PPARG @GENE_5468 @@@PPARgamma@@@ signalling pathway
